intro: Roureopsis stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled rock rose, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, often blooming in spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Roureopsis stenopetala is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
